basics.name: Chris J. Kolenko
basics.label: Principal Engineer / Golang Developer
basics.summary: Software engineer with 17+ years of experience and deep expertise in Golang, CLI tooling, and cross-platform developer experience. Built production CLIs with authentication flows, self-updating mechanisms, and cross-platform distribution. Extensive hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, database migrations, and Postgres across AWS, GCP, and Azure. Passionate about crafting intuitive developer tools that streamline workflows, with a track record of building and shipping developer platforms from the ground up. Active Supabase user across multiple side projects.
points: Built a production Golang CLI for Get No_Ops featuring gcloud-inspired authentication, self-updating, cross-platform support (Windows, Linux, macOS), and package distribution.
17+ years of software development experience with 8+ years building command-line tools and developer workflow automation in Golang.
Deep experience with Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, Git, and container orchestration across production environments.
Strong understanding of Postgres, database migrations, and relational database protocols from building CQRS/Event Sourcing systems.
Active Supabase user building three side projects: Grapevine Network, 1099w9.com, and optrader.com.au.
Proficient in Go, C#, Node.js, and React.js with a focus on cross-platform concerns including filesystem access, subprocess management, and terminal handling.
Experience with package distribution via Homebrew, APT, npm, and custom update mechanisms.
Open source contributor and founder of multiple developer-facing products.

work.summary: Building CI/CD pipelines and developer tooling to streamline development workflows

Collaborated with security and architecture teams to ensure platform reliability and scalability.

work.summary: Built a DevOps/Platform-as-a-Service product with a Golang CLI, backend services, and React portal
highlights: Designed and built a production Golang CLI with gcloud-inspired authentication flows, OAuth/token management, and session handling.
Implemented CLI self-updating mechanism with cross-platform support for Windows, Linux, and macOS.

Built backend services in Golang using CQRS and Event Sourcing patterns with Postgres.
Led a team of 10 engineers across frontend, backend, and infrastructure.
Gathered direct customer feedback to iterate on CLI usability and developer experience.
Achieved a perfect score on the CIS v2 benchmark for security and compliance.
